results.title: Marxism: the theory that split a world
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny, International Cinemedia Centre and Learning Group of America
results.brief_description: A combination of animation, archival material, documentary and fictional recreation is used to portray the history of Karl Marx, and to give the audience an understanding of the influences to his theory of communism.

results.title: Marx for beginners (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bob Godfrey, Contemporary Films and Cucumber Studios
results.brief_description: Bob Godfrey and his collaborators, Clive Morton and Kevin Attew, have created a distillation of the works of Marx. Its intention is to make Marx more accessible and attractive to a wide range of people through its humorous graphic style.

results.title: Marva
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: Marva Collins is a teacher who set up a school in a low income area of Chicago. There are no frills, and students are drilled in vocabulary and multiplication tables, and are required to read one book every two weeks. Many of her students love reading, and Marva is an inspiration to them.

results.title: Martin the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A clay animated film for children about a Russian shoemaker who discovers new meanings in life by meditating on old truths. Based on a Leo Tolstoy folktale “Where Love Is, God Is”. The introduction and narration is by Alexandra Tolstoy, daughter of Leo Tolstoy.

results.title: Martin four
results.creator_credit: Ben Hackworth and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Caught up in the claustrophobic world of his mother, who lives in a drunken haze of romantic memories of exotic places, an aimless young gay man tries to make a connection with love and life in the present. Cast includes Susan Lyons, Todd MacDonald, Suzi Dougherty and Suzy Cato.

results.title: Martha Clarke: light and dark
results.brief_description: The film portrays an artist’s imaginative sources, and the processes through which she creates an evening of theatrical dance. The film departs from traditional dance films by looking behind the finished performance to its imaginative sources and the process by which the performance grows.
results.description: The film portrays an artist’s imaginative sources, and the processes through which she creates an evening of theatrical dance. results.title: Marshland birds I and II: island builders and shore builders
results.brief_description: A study of many British mainland birds - coots, swans, geese, great-crested grebes, snipe, bittern, moorhens, yellow wagtails, bearded tits, reed warblers, and harriers. Their mating, nesting and the hatching and rearing of their young are studied in detail. These birds represent two main types of marshland birds: island builders, and shore builders, according to where they build their nests.

results.title: Mars minus myth
results.brief_description: One of the scientists of the Mariner 9 mission presents some of the geological findings of this mission to Mars. Photographs sent back have stripped away much of the myth surrounding the planet, while raising new questions. Discusses the origins of landforms, the discovery of water ice in the polar caps, the improbability of life and other topics.

results.title: Marrickville
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Russ Hermann and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: The inner-city Sydney suburb of Marrickville is the most ethnically diverse locality in Australia. The suburb’s heavy industry goes back to the mid-19th century and successive generations of migrants have settled and worked in the area. The video celebrates the contribution of Greeks, Yugoslavs and Turks to Sydney, from the post-WWII years to the present, as well as looking at the experiences of more recent migrants from war-torn Lebanon and Vietnam. Through the poetry and prose of migrant Australians and that of their children we hear of the cultural dislocation experienced by residents of Marrickville.

results.title: Marriage is a partnership
results.brief_description: An analysis of some of the problems which arise during the first year of marriage. Outlines adjustments by the married couple to learn to live together: Feeling and acting as a couple rather than as individuals; learning to accept and fulfil new roles, adjusting differences in background; recognizing and accepting personality differences; perceiving and caring for the needs of one another; adjustment to become a member of a new family group; recognising one’s own parents are also in-laws; assuming responsibility in financial matters and in the management of the home.
